results.title: Board and care
results.creator_credit: Ron Ellis, Sarah Pillsbury and National Endowment for the Arts
results.brief_description: Deals with a Down’s Syndrome girl and boy who reveal the deep human need for communication and sharing. Ricky and Lila meet for a brief afternoon of innocent closeness, eating together and talking about what they see. When Lila is sent away to school, Ricky vainly searches the town for her. Featuring Richard Cross as Ricky and Laura Jean Ellis as Lila. (Academy Award Winner in 1980) Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Blueprint for the future: Melbourne 1985
results.brief_description: Describes the Master Plan intended to cope with Melbourne’s traffic situation in 1985. Intense survey work has been carried out, the information analysed in computers and the appropriate plans made, mainly in the form of overpasses and freeways. Stresses the need for a revitalised public transport system as well as roads. Underground railways and streamlined trains and buses are needed. Includes plans for St Kilda Junction, Westgate Bridge and the Melbourne Loop system. Narrated by Leonard Teale.

results.title: Blueprint for survival
results.creator_credit: Densey Clyne, Jim Frazier and Mantis Wildlife Films
results.brief_description: Shows the development of moth, beetle, lacewing and fly larvae, through periodic shedding of the rigid outer coating. Stages in nymphal development of the grasshopper, praying mantis, phasmid and sucking bug, final moult of a cicada and tree cricket and emergence of a butterfly are shown. Suitable for secondary years 7-12.

results.title: Blowing hot and cold
results.creator_credit: Tom Williamson and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Big ice: views of Antarctica”.
Provides statistics on some aspects of the Antarctic continent such as the size of the landmass as compared to Australia and the types of weather conditions experienced. Also presents the latest scientific evidence on the effect of the Antarctic ice mass on world climate. Suitable for secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Blotto
results.creator_credit: James Parrott, Hal Roach and Hal Roach Studios
results.brief_description: An evening of quiet domestic bliss near the old fireside with Mrs Laurel (Anita Garvin) seated at a bridge table playing solitaire as her husband (Stan Laurel) tries to read a newspaper. However, Stan decides he needs a break from this domestic bliss and it falls to his dear friend Ollie (Oliver Hardy) to provide the excuse for his escape. They steal a bottle of booze from Laurel’s wife and head off for a wild old time at the Rainbow Club only to be later thwarted by one very angry wife in the form of Mrs Laurel. A Laurel and Hardy classic even if the plot is somewhat thin.

results.title: Bloody morning [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Li Shaohong and Beijing Film Studio
results.brief_description: Directed by gifted Fifth Generation director Li Shaohong (who went on to make “Blush”), and loosely based on Gabriel Garcia Marquez’s “Chronicle of a Death Foretold”, “Bloody Morning” was banned from export for a number of years. The film, which points to the consequences of poverty and backwardness in rural China, opens with the discovery of a brutal murder in a northern Chinese village. Two brothers readily confess to murdering the local schoolteacher as an act of revenge for the “defilement” of their sister. The story is explored in a complex web of flashbacks triggered by interviews conducted by the magistrate investigating the case. Gradually, a backdrop of complex pre-existing social dynamics emerge - tribal relationships, the puritanical stance of traditional village society, anti-intellectualism, and blood revenge - that provide fertile ground for the ensuing tragedy. In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: Blood: what is it?
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Jim Mann and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: Margaret Brumby from the Monash University and Peter Carolan from the Blood Bank explains the composition of blood, tests and procedures of the Blood Bank and discuss related social issues. The program also shows how a blood smear is made as well as a blood group testing.

results.title: Blood: the microscopic miracle. - 2nd. ed.
results.creator_credit: Bruce D. Hoffman and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: A close-up look at blood using electronmicroscopy and animation to explain its structure and function. The healing of wounds, defending the body from infection and transporting oygen, food, hormones and waste products for the cells in the body are the key functions of blood. Also explains blood groups and what happens in blood transfusions. Useful for middle secondary level biology.

results.title: Blood transfusion
results.creator_credit: H.M. Nieter, Paul Rotha and Paul Rotha Productions
results.brief_description: Tells the story of how doctors and scientists of many nations made possible modern methods of preserving blood and using it far from the places where the blood was given. It traces the development and present operation of the blood donor system in Britain, emphasises the work to be done in peace as well as war, and appeals to everyone to give blood to save the lives of others.

results.title: Blood money
results.creator_credit: Chris Fitchett, Chris Oliver and Tom Broadbridge
results.brief_description: Tense thriller starring Bryan Brown and John Flaus. Pete, a professional criminal who is dying of cancer, returns to Melbourne to settle a few scores. He wants to meet up with his ex-girlfriend and effect a reconciliation before facing death. The crime story is presented entirely from the criminal’s perspective. Rated: M
